text:
March 2 (UPI) -- Real Housewives of New York stars bring the drama in a first Season 10 trailer.

The new season will feature Bethenny Frankel's feud with Carole Radziwill, the death of Jill Zarin's husband, Bobby Zarin, and Luann de Lesseps' arrest.

Frankel explains in a confessional shot that she's "not sure Carole's as excited to see [her] as she used to be." The pair are then seen clashing at what appears to be a 1920s-themed Christmas party.

"Every time we're together, you're aggressive with me," Radziwill says in the preview.

"That's not the case!" Frankel responds.

In contrast, Frankel is seen comforting Zarin following Bobby's death in January. The pair had stopped speaking in 2010 following conflicts on the show, but reconciled at Bobby's funeral, according to Page Six.

"What am I going to do? I've never been alone since I'm 20 years old," Zarin tearfully asks Frankel in the clip.

De Lesseps, meanwhile, is shown returning from rehab in January after seeking treatment for alcohol abuse. The television personality was arrested and charged with disorderly intoxication and battery on a police officer in December.

"I've been traveling, I've been in prison, and I just want to be close to home," she says during a phone call.

The Real Housewives of New York co-stars Ramona Singer, Sonja Morgan, Dorinda Medley and Tinsley Mortimer. Season 10 premieres April 4 on Bravo.
title: 'Real Housewives of New York' teases drama in Season 10 trailer
